Package org.cesecore.keybind

Class InternalKeyBindingMgmtSessionBean

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cesecore.keybind.InternalKeyBindingMgmtSessionBean
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InternalKeyBindingMgmtSession, InternalKeyBindingMgmtSessionLocal, InternalKeyBindingMgmtSessionRemote
    public class InternalKeyBindingMgmtSessionBean
extends Object
implements InternalKeyBindingMgmtSessionLocal, InternalKeyBindingMgmtSessionRemote
    Generic Management implementation for InternalKeyBindings.
    Version:
    $Id: InternalKeyBindingMgmtSessionBean.java 29010 2018-05-23 13:09:53Z jekaterina_b_helmes $

        public InternalKeyBinding getInternalKeyBinding​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                                                int id)
                                         throws AuthorizationDeniedException
        Description copied from interface: InternalKeyBindingMgmtSession
        Get a (cloned) InternalKeyBinding object. Use this method if you might change the object, if the object is handled by an untrusted piece of code or if you are using Remote invocation. (Otherwise, use InternalKeyBindingMgmtSessionLocal.getInternalKeyBindingReference(AuthenticationToken, int) to avoid the unnecessary object creation.)
        Specified by:
        getInternalKeyBinding in interface InternalKeyBindingMgmtSession
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - is the authentication token
        id - is the identifier of the InternalKeyBinding
        Returns:
        the InternalKeyBinding for the requested Id or null if none was found
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if the authentication token was not authorized to fetch the requested InternalKeyBinding

      • getListOfTrustedCertificates

        public List<Collection<X509Certificate>> getListOfTrustedCertificates​(InternalKeyBinding internalKeyBinding)
                                                               throws CADoesntExistsException
        Description copied from interface: InternalKeyBindingMgmtSessionLocal
        Returns a collection of the trusted certificates defined in internalKeyBinding along with their issuers' certificate chains. - If the list of trusted certificates in internalKeyBinding contains certificate serial number(s), only the certificates with these specific serial numbers are trusted - If only trusted CAs are specified in internalKeyBinding, all certificates issued by the specified CAs will be trusted. - If the list of trusted certificates in internalKeyBinding is empty, all certificates issued by all CAs known to this instance of EJBCA are trusted - If the list of trusted certificates in internalKeyBinding is null, no certificates will be trusted.
        Specified by:
        getListOfTrustedCertificates in interface InternalKeyBindingMgmtSessionLocal
        Parameters:
        internalKeyBinding - Binding
        Returns:
        a collection of the trusted certificates along with their issuers' certificate chains or null if no trusted certificates or CAs are specified
        Throws:
        CADoesntExistsException - IF CA not found

      • createInternalKeyBinding

        public int createInternalKeyBinding​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                                    String type,
                                    int id,
                                    String name,
                                    InternalKeyBindingStatus status,
                                    String certificateId,
                                    int cryptoTokenId,
                                    String keyPairAlias,
                                    String signatureAlgorithm,
                                    Map<String,​Serializable> dataMap,
                                    List<InternalKeyBindingTrustEntry> trustedCertificateReferences)
                             throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                                    CryptoTokenOfflineException,
                                    InternalKeyBindingNameInUseException,
                                    InvalidAlgorithmException
        Description copied from interface: InternalKeyBindingMgmtSession
        A createInternalKeyBinding() with allowMissingKeyPair=false
        Specified by:
        createInternalKeyBinding in interface InternalKeyBindingMgmtSession
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - is the authentication token
        type - is the alias of the registered InternalKeyBinding's type
        id - is the id to use for the new InternalKeyBinding, or 0 for automatic choice
        name - is the unique name that this InternalKeyBinding will be given
        status - the initial status to give the InternalKeyBinding
        certificateId - is the certificate fingerprint matching the mapped key pair or null
        cryptoTokenId - is the CryptoToken id of the container where the mapped key pair is stored
        keyPairAlias - is the alias of the mapped key pair in the specified CryptoToken (may not be null)
        signatureAlgorithm - is the signature algorithm that this InternalKeyBinding will use for signatures (if applicable)
        dataMap - is a Map of implementation specific properties for this type of IntenalKeyBinding
        trustedCertificateReferences - Trusted Certificates
        Returns:
        the created InternalKeyBinding's unique identifier
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if the authentication token was not authorized to create the InternalKeyBinding
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - if the requested key pair was not accessible
        InternalKeyBindingNameInUseException - if the requested name was already in use by another InternalKeyBinding
        InvalidAlgorithmException - if the requested signature algorithm is not available
        See Also:
        InternalKeyBindingMgmtSession.createInternalKeyBinding(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken, java.lang.String, int, java.lang.String, org.cesecore.keybind.InternalKeyBindingStatus, java.lang.String, int, java.lang.String, boolean, java.lang.String, java.util.Map<java.lang.String, java.io.Serializable>, java.util.List<org.cesecore.keybind.InternalKeyBindingTrustEntry>)

      • createInternalKeyBinding

        public int createInternalKeyBinding​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                                    String type,
                                    int id,
                                    String name,
                                    InternalKeyBindingStatus status,
                                    String certificateId,
                                    int cryptoTokenId,
                                    String keyPairAlias,
                                    boolean allowMissingKeyPair,
                                    String signatureAlgorithm,
                                    Map<String,​Serializable> dataMap,
                                    List<InternalKeyBindingTrustEntry> trustedCertificateReferences)
                             throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                                    CryptoTokenOfflineException,
                                    InternalKeyBindingNameInUseException,
                                    InvalidAlgorithmException
        Description copied from interface: InternalKeyBindingMgmtSession
        Creates a new InternalKeyBinding using the InternalKeyBindingFactory on the server side.
        Specified by:
        createInternalKeyBinding in interface InternalKeyBindingMgmtSession
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - is the authentication token
        type - is the alias of the registered InternalKeyBinding's type
        id - is the id to use for the new InternalKeyBinding, or 0 for automatic choice
        name - is the unique name that this InternalKeyBinding will be given
        status - the initial status to give the InternalKeyBinding
        certificateId - is the certificate fingerprint matching the mapped key pair or null
        cryptoTokenId - is the CryptoToken id of the container where the mapped key pair is stored
        keyPairAlias - is the alias of the mapped key pair in the specified CryptoToken (may not be null)
        allowMissingKeyPair - if a missing key pair or crypto token should be allowed
        signatureAlgorithm - is the signature algorithm that this InternalKeyBinding will use for signatures (if applicable)
        dataMap - is a Map of implementation specific properties for this type of IntenalKeyBinding
        trustedCertificateReferences - Trusted Certificates
        Returns:
        the created InternalKeyBinding's unique identifier
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if the authentication token was not authorized to create the InternalKeyBinding
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - if the requested key pair was not accessible
        InternalKeyBindingNameInUseException - if the requested name was already in use by another InternalKeyBinding
        InvalidAlgorithmException - if the requested signature algorithm is not available

        public int createInternalKeyBinding​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                                    String type,
                                    String name,
                                    InternalKeyBindingStatus status,
                                    String certificateId,
                                    int cryptoTokenId,

                                    CryptoTokenOfflineException,
                                    InternalKeyBindingNameInUseException,
                                    InvalidAlgorithmException
        Description copied from interface: InternalKeyBindingMgmtSession
        A createInternalKeyBinding() that chooses the id of the new object automatically.
        Specified by:
        createInternalKeyBinding in interface InternalKeyBindingMgmtSession
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - is the authentication token
        type - is the alias of the registered InternalKeyBinding's type
        name - is the unique name that this InternalKeyBinding will be given
        status - the initial status to give the InternalKeyBinding
        certificateId - is the certificate fingerprint matching the mapped key pair or null
        cryptoTokenId - is the CryptoToken id of the container where the mapped key pair is stored
        keyPairAlias - is the alias of the mapped key pair in the specified CryptoToken (may not be null)
        signatureAlgorithm - is the signature algorithm that this InternalKeyBinding will use for signatures (if applicable)
        dataMap - is a Map of implementation specific properties for this type of IntenalKeyBinding
        trustedCertificateReferences - Trusted Certificates
        Returns:
        the created InternalKeyBinding's unique identifier

      • persistInternalKeyBinding

        public int persistInternalKeyBinding​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                                     InternalKeyBinding internalKeyBinding)
                              throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                                     InternalKeyBindingNameInUseException
        Description copied from interface: InternalKeyBindingMgmtSession
        Create new (when the provided InternalKeyBinding has id 0) or merge existing InternalKeyBinding. The caller must be authorized the modify the InternalKeyBinding and to CryptoTokenRules.USE the referenced CryptoToken.
        Specified by:
        persistInternalKeyBinding in interface InternalKeyBindingMgmtSession
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - is the authentication token
        internalKeyBinding - is the InternalKeyBinding to persist
        Returns:
        the internalKeyBindingId that can be used for future reference if the object was created
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if the authentication token is not authorized to modify the InternalKeyBinding or use the CryptoToken
        InternalKeyBindingNameInUseException - if the name is already in use by an InternalKeyBinding with a different id

      • deleteInternalKeyBinding

        public boolean deleteInternalKeyBinding​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                                        int internalKeyBindingId)
                                 throws AuthorizationDeniedException
        Description copied from interface: InternalKeyBindingMgmtSession
        Delete an InternalKeyBinding (this will not remove any referenced object like keys or certificates).
        Specified by:
        deleteInternalKeyBinding in interface InternalKeyBindingMgmtSession
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - is the authentication token
        internalKeyBindingId - is the unique InternalKeyBinding identifier
        Returns:
        true if the InternalKeyBinding existed before deletion
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if the authentication token is not authorized to delete this InternalKeyBinding

      • generateNextKeyPair

        public String generateNextKeyPair​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                                  int internalKeyBindingId)
                           throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                                  CryptoTokenOfflineException,
                                  InvalidKeyException,
                                  InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        Description copied from interface: InternalKeyBindingMgmtSession
        Creates a new key pair with the same key specification as the current and a new alias. If a nextKey reference already exists, it will be replaced with a reference to the new key.
        Specified by:
        generateNextKeyPair in interface InternalKeyBindingMgmtSession
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - is the authentication token
        internalKeyBindingId - is the unique identifier of the InternalKeyBinding
        Returns:
        the new key pair alias
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if the authentication token was not authorized to this operation
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - if the CryptoToken mapped by this InternalKeyBinding is not available
        InvalidKeyException - if the current key spec could not be read and used properly
        InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - if the current key algo could not be read and used properly

      • getNextPublicKeyForInternalKeyBinding

        public byte[] getNextPublicKeyForInternalKeyBinding​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                                                    int internalKeyBindingId)
                                             throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                                                    CryptoTokenOfflineException
        Description copied from interface: InternalKeyBindingMgmtSession
        Get the next key pair alias to use for renewals. If the next key field of the InternalKeyBinding is not set, the current key pair alias will be returned instead.
        Specified by:
        getNextPublicKeyForInternalKeyBinding in interface InternalKeyBindingMgmtSession
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - is the authentication token
        internalKeyBindingId - is the unique identifier of the InternalKeyBinding
        Returns:
        the public key in DER format
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if the authentication token is not authorized to get this information
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - if the public key could not be retrieved from the referenced CryptoToken

      • generateCsrForNextKey

        public byte[] generateCsrForNextKey​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                                    int internalKeyBindingId,
                                    byte[] name)
                             throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                                    CryptoTokenOfflineException
        Description copied from interface: InternalKeyBindingMgmtSession
        Generate a Certificate Signing Request (CSR) for the next key to be mapped by this InternalKeyBinging. If no explicit "next" key exists a CSR for the current key will be returned (e.g. only renew cert, but not keys).
        Specified by:
        generateCsrForNextKey in interface InternalKeyBindingMgmtSession
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - is the authentication token
        internalKeyBindingId - is the unique identifier of the InternalKeyBinding
        name - the subjectDN to be used in the CSR as binary encoded X500Name (X500Name.getEncoded), or null. If null the currently mapped certificate's SubjectDN will be used (if present) and if not a default (CN=Internal Key Binding Name),
        Returns:
        the a new PKCS#10 request for the InternalKeyBinding
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - is the authentication token is not authorized to this operation
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - if the key pair is not available

      • updateCertificateForInternalKeyBinding

        public String updateCertificateForInternalKeyBinding​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                                                     int internalKeyBindingId)
                                              throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                                                     CertificateImportException
        Description copied from interface: InternalKeyBindingMgmtSession
        Update the key mapping if there is a newer certificate in the database or a certificate matching the nextKey. This could normally be used in a setup where the certificate is published or made available be other means in the database for this EJBCA instance.
        Specified by:
        updateCertificateForInternalKeyBinding in interface InternalKeyBindingMgmtSession
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - is the authentication token
        internalKeyBindingId - is the unique identifier of the InternalKeyBinding
        Returns:
        the certificate's fingerprint if a change was made or null otherwise
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if the authentication token was not authorized to this operation
        CertificateImportException - if the certificate could not be mapped (keys unavailable or wrong type of certificate)

      • setStatus

        public boolean setStatus​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                         int internalKeyBindingId,
                         InternalKeyBindingStatus status)
                  throws AuthorizationDeniedException
        Description copied from interface: InternalKeyBindingMgmtSession
        Update the status of the InternalKeyBinding. Note that it is not possible to enable an InternalKeyBinding that has no certificate mapping.
        Specified by:
        setStatus in interface InternalKeyBindingMgmtSession
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - is the authentication token
        internalKeyBindingId - is the unique identifier of the InternalKeyBinding
        status - is one of org.cesecore.keybind.InternalKeyBindingStatus enum
        Returns:
        true if the status was modified
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - of the authentication token is not authorized to this operation

      • importCertificateForInternalKeyBinding

        public void importCertificateForInternalKeyBinding​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                                                   int internalKeyBindingId,
                                                   byte[] derEncodedCertificate)
                                            throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                                                   CertificateImportException
        Description copied from interface: InternalKeyBindingMgmtSession
        Imports the certificate provided in DER format to the database and updates the InternalKeyBinding reference. If the the certificates public key matches the current instance's keyPairAlias, the keyPairAlias will not be updated. If the nextKey property is set and the certificates public key matches, the instance's keyPairAlias will also be updated.
        Specified by:
        importCertificateForInternalKeyBinding in interface InternalKeyBindingMgmtSession
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - is the authentication token
        internalKeyBindingId - is the unique identifier of the InternalKeyBinding
        derEncodedCertificate - DER encoded certificate to import
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if the authentication token was not authorized to this operation
        CertificateImportException - if the provided certificate's public key does not match current or next key. This is also thrown if the implementation cannot validate that the certificate is of the right type.

      • renewInternallyIssuedCertificate

        public String renewInternallyIssuedCertificate​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                                               int internalKeyBindingId,
                                               EndEntityInformation endEntityInformation)
                                        throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                                               CryptoTokenOfflineException,
                                               CertificateImportException
        Description copied from interface: InternalKeyBindingMgmtSession
        Issue a new certificate using the same end entity as the current certificate. Note that this will only work as long as the CA is internal and the user and profiles still exist. Since the user's current CA and profiles will be used, they could be changed before this call.
        Specified by:
        renewInternallyIssuedCertificate in interface InternalKeyBindingMgmtSession
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - is the authentication token
        internalKeyBindingId - is the unique identifier of the InternalKeyBinding
        endEntityInformation - is the template to use for the renewal
        Returns:
        the newly issued certificate's fingerprint
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if the authentication token is not authorized to this operation
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - if the mapped CryptoToken or keys are not available
        CertificateImportException - if the newly issued certificate cannot be used with this InternalKeyBinding (e.g. the EEP might have changed)
